body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

> Uncomment only one, leave it on its own line:
>
/kind bug
> /kind feature


**What happened**:
The output of my kubeadm:
```
$  kubeadm init --config kubeadm-config.yaml
[endpoint] WARNING: port specified in api.controlPlaneEndpoint overrides api.bindPort in the controlplane address
[init] using Kubernetes version: v1.11.0
[preflight] running pre-flight checks
	[WARNING Firewalld]: firewalld is active, please ensure ports [6443 10250] are open or your cluster may not function correctly
	[WARNING HTTPProxy]: Connection to "https://192.168.111.129" uses proxy "http://xx.xx.xx.xx:8080/". If that is not intended, adjust your proxy settings
	[WARNING HTTPProxyCIDR]: connection to "10.96.0.0/12" uses proxy "http://xx.xx.xx.xx:8080/". This may lead to malfunctional cluster setup. Make sure that Pod and Services IP ranges specified correctly as exceptions in proxy configuration
	[WARNING FileExisting-socat]: socat not found in system path
I0703 19:20:43.900948   10957 kernel_validator.go:81] Validating kernel version
I0703 19:20:43.901042   10957 kernel_validator.go:96] Validating kernel config
	[WARNING Service-Kubelet]: kubelet service is not enabled, please run 'systemctl enable kubelet.service'
[preflight/images] Pulling images required for setting up a Kubernetes cluster
[preflight/images] This might take a minute or two, depending on the speed of your internet connection
[preflight/images] You can also perform this action in beforehand using 'kubeadm config images pull'
[preflight] Some fatal errors occurred:
	[ERROR ImagePull]: failed to pull image [k8s.gcr.io/coredns-amd64:1.1.3]: exit status 1
[preflight] If you know what you are doing, you can make a check non-fatal with `--ignore-preflight-errors=...`
$ kubeadm config images pull
[config/images] Pulled k8s.gcr.io/kube-apiserver-amd64:v1.11.0
[config/images] Pulled k8s.gcr.io/kube-controller-manager-amd64:v1.11.0
[config/images] Pulled k8s.gcr.io/kube-scheduler-amd64:v1.11.0
[config/images] Pulled k8s.gcr.io/kube-proxy-amd64:v1.11.0
[config/images] Pulled k8s.gcr.io/pause-amd64:3.1
[config/images] Pulled k8s.gcr.io/etcd-amd64:3.2.18
failed to pull image "k8s.gcr.io/coredns-amd64:1.1.3": exit status 1
$ kubeadm version
kubeadm version: &version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"12+", GitVersion:"v1.12.0-alpha.0.1793+fc081b5941b90a", GitCommit:"fc081b5941b90aa6dedbc796f97a19da373c5df9", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-07-03T10:14:52Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.2", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```


When I pull the image with docker pull, I get such output:
```
# sudo docker pull k8s.gcr.io/coredns-amd64:1.1.3
Trying to pull repository k8s.gcr.io/coredns-amd64 ... 
Pulling repository k8s.gcr.io/coredns-amd64
unauthorized: authentication required
```

But other images are successfully pulled as we can see from previous log.
Why?

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Cluster Lifecycle.
labels.name: sig/cluster-lifecycle

title: [kubeadm]failed to pull image "k8s.gcr.io/coredns-amd64:1.1.3": exit status 1
